title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. V, subch. A, pt. 303 - Resolution Of Workers' Compensation Claims Of Officers And Employees Of The Workers' Compensation Board And The State Insurance Fund
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. V, subch. A, pt. 303 - Resolution Of Workers' Compensation Claims Of Officers And Employees Of The Workers' Compensation Board And The State Insurance Fund

State Regulations
§ 303.1 - Statement of purpose
§ 303.2 - Use of impartial specialist for claims of officers and employees of the workers' compensation board and the state insurance fund
§ 303.3 - Resolution of workers' compensation claims of certain officers and employees of the workers' compensation board and the state insurance fund
§ 303.4 - Applicability of board rules and regulations
§ 303.5 - Filing of claims of designated officers and employees
§ 303.6 - Appointment of arbitrator; powers and duties
§ 303.7 - Procedural rules
§ 303.8 - Decision and award of arbitrator
§ 303.9 - Panel review of arbitrator decision
§ 303.10 - Costs and expenses of arbitration

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. V, subch. A, pt. 303

Statutory authority: Workers' Compensation Law, §§ 20, 25[8], 110 [5], 117[1], 141

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
